definition: please forgive me
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect

sentences.english: Nothing technical content, but also hope that you will be forgiven.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼技術含量，還望高手見諒。

sentences.english: I don't have time for proof-reading, so forgive me if there is any clerical error .
sentences.chinese: 沒時間檢查拼寫了，如有任何書寫錯誤，見諒了。

sentences.english: Sorry for any inconvenience caused, your assistance will be highly appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝您的協助，如造成您的不便，煩請見諒。

sentences.english: Remove photo directly without further notice, please forgive me.
sentences.chinese: 直接移除照片而不另行通知，敬請見諒。

sentences.english: A good wife always forgives her husbwhen she's wrong. (Milton Berle)
sentences.chinese: 一個好妻子總會在她錯了的期間見諒她的丈夫。

sentences.english: Haha, my English is poor, so please forgive me of all overseas Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，我的英語水平差，所以請各僑胞們見諒。

sentences.english: We apologize for any inconvenience that may be caused.
sentences.chinese: 對各住戶造成不便，敬希見諒。

definition: incorrectly written or mispronounced characters
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
usage (of a term)/wording/phrasing
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to digress/to stray from the subject
please see .../vide
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
may I offer a bit of advice
(pron) everyone/Ladies and Gentlemen/Sirs
